TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit CreateAttachmentType extends ExchangeWebServices.BaseRequestType

Docs.summary: The class represents a request to attach an item or file to a specified item in the Exchange database.

remarks.para: You cannot attach an existing item to another item. To attach the contents of an existing item, pass the of the existing item to the attachment that you want to create. Make sure that you null out all properties that are returned for an existing item. Only the Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) content should be used in the attachment. If you try to attach an existing item to another item, the response will contain an error because the Exchange database cannot include duplicate item identifiers.

example.para: The following code example shows a create attachment request that creates a file and item attachment on an existing item in the Exchange database.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: The constructor initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::AttachmentType ^> ^ Attachments { cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::AttachmentType ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <ExchangeWebServices::AttachmentType ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the attachments to create for the CreateAttachment operation.
Docs.value: The property returns an array that contains the set of attachments.

remarks.para: The property can contain a set of file and item attachments.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property ExchangeWebServices::ItemIdType ^ ParentItemId { ExchangeWebServices::ItemIdType ^ get(); void set(ExchangeWebServices::ItemIdType ^ value); };

Docs.summary: The property gets or sets the parent item in the Exchange database that receives the attachments.
Docs.value: The property returns an that represents the identifier of the parent item.

remarks.para: The parent item property will change when the attachments are attached to it.
